details.title: Correction to “Some Remarks on Rare-Event Approximation”
details.abstract: In the above titled paper (ibid., vol. 45, no.1, pp. 106-108, Mar 96), corrections were made to an equation found on p. 106, column 2, line 6.

references.title: Some remarks on rare-event approximation

context.text: In the paper cited above [1], page 106, column 2, line 6, the definition of \$\psi\$ is wrong: \$\psi\$ is defined as:It should be: .

links.abstract: Two fault-tree analysis methods to compute the minimal cutsets union probability are: the rare-event approximation, and the minimal cutset upper-bound. The rare-event approximation is accurate if all the basic events have low probabilities. The accuracy improvement provided by the minimal cutset upper-bound approximation is negligible.

references.text: J. Collet, "Some remarks on rare-event approximation", IEEE Trans. Rel., vol. 45, no. 1, pp. 106-108, March 1996.
